critique: The document establishes a bipartisan commission to study capital budgeting practices. It aims to improve budget decision-making and accounting in the Federal Government by examining capital budgeting practices in other countries, state and local governments, and the private sector. The commission will report on the definition of capital, the role of depreciation, and the effect of a Federal capital budget on budgetary choices. The document does not express strong opinions on ideological tilt, immigration, executive power, federalism, security vs. liberty, economic regulation, or social inclusion.
